translation: The anger-less, prideless, supremely joyful Nityānanda Rāy wanders throughout the towns.

text: adhama patita jīver dvāre dvāre giyā
translation: Going from door to door to the homes of the lowly and fallen souls, He distributes the Hare Kṛṣṇa mahāmantra.

text: yāre dekhe tāre kahe dante tṛṇa dhari’
translation: With straw between His teeth, He says to whoever He sees, “Purchase Me: simply serve Gaurahari.”

text: eta bali’ nityānanda bhūme gaḍi yāya
translation: Saying this, Nityānanda rolls on the ground like a golden mountain rolling in the dust.

text: hena avatāre yāra rati nā janmila
lochan bale sei pāpī ela āra gela
translation: Lochan Dās says of one who has not developed attachment to this Avatār, “Such a sinner simply came and went.”

text: (nitāi-charaṇ nā bhajila    yāoyā āsā sār ha-ila)
translation: “They simply came and went. Those who did not serve Nitāi’s feet simply came and went (took birth and died uselessly).”
